title: Bazaar
summary: A bazaar (or souk) (persian: بازار) is a marketplace consisting of multiple small stalls or shops,[1] especially in the Middle East[2][1] and India.[1] Bazaars in the Middle East were traditionally located in vaulted or covered streets that had doors on each end[3] and served as a city's central marketplace.[3] Street markets are the European and North American equivalents.
